00029 class SC_API ispex_base;

00037 SC_API_TEMPLATE_DECL_ tlm_array<tlm_utils::ispex_base*>;
00038 } // namespace tlm
00039 
00040 namespace tlm_utils {
00041 
00042 //The private extension base. Similar to normal extension base, but without clone and free
00043 class SC_API ispex_base
00044 {
00045     friend class tlm::tlm_array<ispex_base*>;
00046     void free() {} // needed for explicit tlm_array instantiation
00047 public:
00048     virtual ~ispex_base() {}
00049 protected:
00050     static unsigned int register_private_extension(const std::type_info&);
00051 };
00052 
00053 //this thing is basically a snippet of the generic_payload
00054 // it contains all the extension specific code (the extension API so to speak)
00055 // the differences are:
00056 // - it calls back to its owner whenever a real (==non-NULL) extension gets set for the first time
00057 // - it calls back to its owner whenever a living (==non-NULL) extension gets cleared
00058 class SC_API instance_specific_extensions_per_accessor
00059 {
00060 public:
00061   typedef instance_specific_extension_container container_type;
00062 
00063   explicit
00064   instance_specific_extensions_per_accessor(container_type* container)
00065     : m_container(container)
00066   {}
00067 
00068   template <typename T> T* set_extension(T* ext)
00069   {
00070       return static_cast<T*>( set_extension(T::priv_id, ext) );
00071   }
00072 
00073   // non-templatized version with manual index:
00074   ispex_base* set_extension(unsigned int index, ispex_base* ext);
00075 
00076   // Check for an extension, ext will point to 0 if not present
00077   template <typename T> void get_extension(T*& ext) const
00078   {
00079       ext = static_cast<T*>(get_extension(T::priv_id));
00080   }
00081   // Non-templatized version:
00082    ispex_base* get_extension(unsigned int index) const;
00083 
00084   // Clear extension, the argument is needed to find the right index:
00085   template <typename T> void clear_extension(const T*)
00086   {
00087       clear_extension(T::priv_id);
00088   }
00089 
00090   // Non-templatized version with manual index
00091   void clear_extension(unsigned int index);
00092 
00093   // Make sure the extension array is large enough. Can be called once by
00094   // an initiator module (before issuing the first transaction) to make
00095   // sure that the extension array is of correct size. This is only needed
00096   // if the initiator cannot guarantee that the generic payload object is
00097   // allocated after C++ static construction time.
00098   void resize_extensions();
00099 
00100 private:
00101   tlm::tlm_array<ispex_base*> m_extensions;
00102   container_type* m_container;
00103 
00104 }; // class instance_specific_extensions_per_accessor
00105 
00106 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(SC_WIN_DLL_WARN)
00107 #pragma warning(push)
00108 #pragma warning(disable: 4251) // DLL import for vector
00109 #endif
00110 
00111 //this thing contains the vector of extensions per accessor
00112 //which can be really large so this one should be pool allocated
00113 // therefore it keeps a use_count of itself to automatically free itself
00114 // - to this end it provides callbacks to the extensions per accessor
00115 //   to increment and decrement the use_count
00116 class SC_API instance_specific_extension_container
00117 {
00118   friend class instance_specific_extension_accessor;
00119   friend class instance_specific_extension_carrier;
00120   friend class instance_specific_extension_container_pool;
00121   friend class instance_specific_extensions_per_accessor;
00122 
00123   typedef void release_fn(instance_specific_extension_carrier*,void*);
00124 
00125   instance_specific_extension_container();
00126   ~instance_specific_extension_container();
00127 
00128   void resize();
00129 
00130   void inc_use_count();
00131   void dec_use_count();
00132 
00133   static instance_specific_extension_container* create();
00134   void attach_carrier(instance_specific_extension_carrier*, void* txn, release_fn*);
00135 
00136   instance_specific_extensions_per_accessor* get_accessor(unsigned int index);
00137 
00138   std::vector<instance_specific_extensions_per_accessor*> m_ispex_per_accessor;
00139   unsigned int use_count;
00140   void* m_txn;
00141   release_fn* m_release_fn;
00142   instance_specific_extension_carrier* m_carrier;
00143   instance_specific_extension_container* next; //for pooling
00144 
00145 }; // class instance_specific_extension_container
00146 
00147 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(SC_WIN_DLL_WARN)
00148 #pragma warning(pop)
00149 #endif
00150 
00151 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00152 
00153 //This class 'hides' all the instance specific extension stuff from the user
00154 // he instantiates one of those (e.g. instance_specific_extension_accessor extAcc;) and can then access
00155 // the private extensions
00156 //    extAcc(txn).extensionAPIFnCall()
00157 //  where extensionAPIFnCall is set_extension, get_extension, clear_extension,...
00158 class SC_API instance_specific_extension_accessor
00159 {
00160 public:
00161   instance_specific_extension_accessor();
00162 
00163   template<typename T> // implementation in instance_specific_extensions.h
00164   inline instance_specific_extensions_per_accessor& operator()(T& txn);
00165 
00166 protected:
00167   template<typename T>
00168   static void release_carrier(instance_specific_extension_carrier*, void* txn);
00169 
00170   unsigned int m_index;
00171 }; // class instance_specific_extension_accessor
00172 
00173 } // namespace tlm_utils
